column1: good length on middle and angling across Gayle, left alone. Nice carry through. Breezy day
left alone once again. Good length on middle and goes past Gayle's shoulders
slightly fuller pitching on off stump, Gayle contemplates playing at it, but covers his line and lets the ball go past his bat
full on leg stump and first touch of the bat. Takes the edge of the bat and flies away along the ground to gully
shoulders his arms this time, it's overpitched outside off and Gayle lets it go
just past his outside edge! Beautifully delivered full just outside off, forces Gayle to prod at it. Not much footwork and zips past his outside edge.
good length outside off stump, left alone by Evin Lewis.
Lewis leaves again but not before checking he's in front of off stump. Full ball just outside off and swings slightly away from the left-hander. Nice carry through
hurries Lewis to defend off the back foot. Fuller ball on off stump and angling into the left-hander. Hint of shape
overpitched on leg stump, comes inside the line of the ball and drives towards the on side. Straight to mid on
shoulders his arms this time, good length wide outside off. Still careful, Lewis
full on off stump and crisply driven on the up.Intercepted by cover. Two maidens in a row
The first real short ball of the day. Pitched short on leg stump and forces Gayle to duck. The big man does well to somehow get under it
good length on middle and going across Gayle's body. Shoulders his arms this time. Still no runs
in the air, but just short of mid on! Full on middle and Gayle's bat turns while driving towards the on side. Just short of Bracewell, who was on the circle's line
full on off stump and left alone by Gayle once again. Nice length from Southee
short again, pitching on leg stump and rising over Gayle's ducking head. Taken by the keeper from over his head
good length on middle and pushed across Gayle. He's happy to let it go. Still no runs after three overs.
first runs, but not off the bat. Good length on middle and angling past Lewis' body down the leg side
full on middle and leg and angles onto Lewis' pads. Tries to drive but misses. Hits his pads, and big appeal from Boult but it would've gone down leg side
very short outside off stump, Lewis gets his head out of the ball's way as it whizzes past his ear
good length just outside off stump on the fourth-stump line. Lewis is happy to shoulder his arms.
good length on off stump, Lewis lets it go through to the keeper
fuller this time, pitches on middle. Lewis is quick to shuffle across and tap the ball towards midwicket but the fielder is positioned there
short on off stump and gets big onto Lewis. Does well to drop his knees and duck under the balll
full just outside leg stump, misses the whip and hits his pad. Gayle's lazy to take off for the single, and he has to hurry towards the non-striker's. Bad throw, but the big man was in already
full on middle stump and Lewis offers the full face of the bat. Driven past the non-striker to mid off
short on leg stump and Lewis is quick to duck under this eye-level ball. Sharp take from the keeper
full on off stump and pushes at this delivery. Nice timing and the natural slice of Lewis' shot takes it past covers. Runs off the bat for the first time
short on middle, Lewis seemed to be prepared for it. Quick to drop his knees and get away from this stinker
good length on middle, gets behind the line of the ball and punches back past Gayle to mid off
full toss on middle stump and onto Gayle's pads. Flicked off his hips fine down the leg side. There's the boundary
good length outside off, Gayle gets his bat near his chest and taps towards point. Calls early for the single
decked short outside off once again, zips past Lewis' ears as he stands tall and gets away
beautiful shot! Driven on the up past point. May have intended to play this straighter but goes square in the gap. Williamson had to give it a chase
full on middle, Lewis cuts the line of the ball and blocks towards mid on
gloriously cut past the diving point fielder. No chance after that. Lewis stood tall to this short ball outside off and muscled this just behind square. Boundary to end the over
Gayle in no mood to engage. On a good length, accurate as ever, on middle and off. The batsman's happy to let it go
short on leg stump, flies past Gayle who gets his head out of the ball's trajectory. Still patient
Lifted over long off! Fuller ball on middle and Gayle shuffles down the wicket and smashed with ease.
fuller outside off, gets the front foot out of the way and slices this over point's head. Not where he wanted it to go, as the ball falls just inside the ropes
Southee goes back to the short ball. Pitches on leg stump and Gayle defends off the back foot. Trickles away towards point, who attacks the ball, and ensures there's no single
yorker on middle stump, gets his toes out of the way and digs it out but the ball takes the inside edge and hits his boot. Gayle did well to get his bat down in time
good length outside off stump, happy to let it go through to Latham
punched off the back foot, but straight to mid on. Good length ball that Lewis got behind pretty quickly
short on off stump and jumps off the surface. A good foot over Lewis' head
good length wide outside off, Lewis extravagantly shoulders his arms. The keeper takes it from almost near the ground
full on middle and leg, clipped off his toes to wide mid on. Nicely timed but can't find the gap. Way too many dot balls
sliced over mid off's head for more runs. Good length outside off and tries to muscle this more over cover, but the mis-hit takes it just over KW's head
back of a length outside off, tries to cut but the ball stays low. Takes the bottom edge and goes towards point. No run
good length on middle, Gayle backs away and pokes at this delivery away from his body. Towards point this time
brilliant ball, and a great take from Latham! Yorker outside leg stump and Gayle's beaten completely. Sharp take from the keeper as he dives to his right. Not his primary hand
short on middle stump and zips past Gayle's head. Happy to let that go once again
very full on off stump and goes just past off stump! Gayle tried to dig this out but couldn't. Lucky
slower ball on middle stump, through his shot early but driven with enough muscle to take this towards mid off for a quick run

finds the gap between point and gully! Overpitched wide outside off and Lewis gets down on one knee and simply opens the bat's face as he makes contact on the full. Guided between the two fielders behind square
full on leg stump, clipped off his toes in front of midwicket. No fielder there, and a run
full outside leg stump and whipped off his ankles down to third man. Ferguson bowling at 147 kph. whoo
shorter this time on leg stump but not much bounce from this side. Defended off the back foot

full on off stump and Gayle backs away to make some extra room. Slogged straight past the bowler, and despite the ball not being timed well, enough muscle behind the shot to beat Boult's chase from mid on
good length on middle stump, cross-batted slog towards midwicket. The bat turned in his hand
Lewis surprised by the pace this time. Short on leg stump this time and Gayle does really well to somehow get his head out of the ball's way. Fiery way to end the power

What a comeback for this man! First ball after a long break and takes a feather edge off Gayle's bat! Good length on middle and angling past Gayle's body. Gayle's enticed to poke at it and takes the slightest of edges off his bat. Latham safe as a church. Big wicket
good length wide outside off stump, shapes further away from the right hander. Just over the tram lines.

Another wicket! Or is it? Hope reviews for the caught-behind. Good length on off stump and cuts Hope in half as he tries to flick towards the leg side with the ball going between bat and trouser. Extra bounce once again and another faint edge off the inside edge of the bat. Hope's gone for a duck!
ooo, first slip was appealing even before the ball went past his bat! Cross seaming delivery similar to the one that got Gayle. The left-hander almost played at it before pulling his bat back
firmly defended off the back foot. Shortish on middle and rising onto the left-handed batsman. Tiptoes and blocks
full on off stump and just past off stump as Hetmyer chooses to shoulder his arms. Well calculated from the batsman
short on leg stump and forces the batsman to duck. High take from the keeper. Bracewell's given a tap on his head from Southee and Williamson at the over's conclusion
full on middle and Lewis offers the straight bat but the ball takes the outside edge. Goes along the ground past point's left
surprises everyone! Short on leg and zips past the batsman's helmet. Latham does well to get his body behind that ball as well
good length on leg stump, tiptoes and blocks off his back foot. Tapped towards cover
good length on leg stump and cramping the batsman. Flicked off his hips to fine leg
short-ish ball on off stump, gets on top of the bounce and defends
short on middle and another quick, short ball to end the over. The batsman gets his head out of the ball's way as it goes past him
good length on middle, check-shot punch off the back foot towards cover. Was in two minds there
more of the short stuff! Lewis does well to drop his knees in a jiffy and get down. He's on the floor, actually, but has a smile on his face.
fuller ball on middle and leg, slower ball this time. Defended with the straight bat but comes off the outside edge
carved off the back foot past point, and no chance for Boult at third man. Good length on middle and not enough room to completely cut square but enough off the blade to thread the gap
full on middle, big stride forward and driven along the ground to long on. The batsmen walk through for the single
streaky! Over first slip! Short on middle and cramps the batsman for room. Tries to pull but takes the top edge. Gets the runs, though
good length on middle, tapped off the back foot towards midwicket but takes the leading edge to short point. Hetmyer calls early for the single
full outside leg and going down the leg side. Latham runs to his right to keep it down to only the extra. Hetmyer, too, gave it a wild leg-side swing but couldn't connect
tapped off his waist to midwicket for a quick single. Short on middle and Hetmyer did well to stay over the ball while playing the shot
short outside leg and meets Lewis near his chest. Defended off the back foot with ease
sticks with the short stuff. First bouncer of over, reminds the umpire. Pitches outside leg and over the ducking batsman's head
fuller ball on leg stump, driven back to the bowler, who does well to get down on his follow through to stop the ball from going past him
short ball on leg stump, drops his knees and gets under the ball again. He's mastered this technique
full on middle stump, driven past Lewis off the front foot to mid off
low full toss on off stump, a slower ball that goes wrong. Flicked off his toes towards cow corner, beats deep midwicket's chase
short on middle stump, worked off his hips to fine leg
good length on middle stump, angling away from Hetmyer. Cut away from his body to the fielder at point
decked short on leg stump, and goes over the ducking batsman's head. Taken by Latham from in front of his face
full ball on middle, nice rip but no real spin this time. Driven towards cover
good length on middle and turning into the left-hander, worked off his waist to deep midwicket
the wrong'un, good length on middle and turns away from Lewis. The batsman backs away and punches with the bat's toe end towards deep extra cover
good length on middle and goes straight through, punched once again off the back foot and forces wide long off to give it a chase
squirts away past first slip! Another wrong'un from Astle. Fuller ball from the back of the hand and goes away from the batsman. Tried to defend and took the outside edge
Full-ish on off stump, stays slightly low as Lewis defends with soft hands
mistimed pull but just short of Worker at midwicket. In the slot to be punished but not timed well enough because of the extra bounce. Lucky break
fuller on off stump, and Lewis cuts very late square towards third man. In two minds whether to carve this behind square or in front of it. Eventually mistimed
full on off stump, driven on the up off the front foot. But straight to KW at mid off. Off the center of the bat
this time it's muscled over midwicket! Short on middle and a comfortable height to pull across the line. Over the infield and no stopping that
short on middle and angling away from the batsman, cut off the back foot but comes off the toe end. Goes to point
good length on middle and angling across his body, tapped towards the off side to see the over out
tossed up full on off stump, comfortably driven along the ground past cover to deep extra
another flighter on middle stump. Not afraid to give it a toss. Driven down the ground
flatter ball and it's the wrong'un, spins away after pitching on middle, off the bottom of the bat as he cuts past cover point
full ball on off stump, driven from near his toes square on the off side. There's man in the deep for that very shot
keeps his eyes on the ball and cuts behind square for more runs. Good length on middle and another googly but studiously played with his eye on the ball at all times
good length on middle and hurries onto the batsman's pads. Gets his blade down in time to squeeze this out
muscled over wide mid on! Short on middle and allows Hetmyer to free his arms. Backs away towards the leg side and despite the slice off the bat, the shot has enough power behind it
wide outside off on a good length, cut square off the back foot. Good connection off the blade
full on off stump and angling into his body, defended but off the inside edge to square leg. Skid off the surface

slower ball this time, on a good length outside off, defended with soft hands with the bat's open face and worked into the gap in front of square. Lewis calls early for the dangerous single, but completed with ease

extra bounce, and just past the diving point! Good length outside off and bounces higher than expected. Cuts at it, but undercuts the ball, lobbing it in the air. But the fielder's outstretched hands just could not get to it
good length outside off, punched towards cover off the front foot
full ball on off stump, tight line once again. Driven square off the front foot
good length on middle and off, waits late for the ball before cutting but can't find the gap
good length on off stump once again, makes room to cut but played too square. Straight to point
tossed up wide outside off and spinning further away, cut past the gap on the infield this time. Only a single, though
close one! Lewis expected the wrong'un this time. Good length on middle and turning away from him. Had covered his off stump in any case as he shoulders his arms
good length on middle and leg, quick to back away and punch off the back foot to long off
good length on off stump but drifts down the leg side. Has to restart
delivers this from wide around the wicket, full on middle and defended
carved over cover for a beautiful four. Full but wide outside off allowing Lewis to free his arms. Big stride forward and struck with power
full just outside off, uses his front foot to drive along the bowler's right to mid off
full and wide outside off, wild slash at it from Lewis. Flies over point's head and falls in front of the fielder in the deep. The bat turned in his hand as he looked to muscle this away
good length on middle, tapped off the back foot to mid on
back of a length on middle stump, backs away and punches square off the back foot. Fielder in the deep
tossed up outside off, enticing ball to hit but only driven down the non-striker's right to long off. Not afraid to give the ball a real rip
the topspinner this time, good length on middle and off, goes straight through thereafter. Tapped off the back foot to long off once again
extravagantly driven off one knee to deep extra cover, fuller ball outside off and he was quick to pounce onto the little bit of width offered
full on middle, driven with the bat's open face to deep point. Five singles off five balls
full outside off stump, pushed towards deep cover for another run off the front foot
full outside off and that's the straightest of straight drives. So well hit that it breaks middle stump of the non-striker's. Saves a boundary, that wicket
short and wide outside off, enough room to free his arms but cut off the toe end towards point instead. Missed opportunity for certain
slower ball full outside off, through his drive too early but enough wood behind it to take the ball down to long off
good length ball outside off but angling into the left-hander, defended off the back foot towards the cover region
just past the outside edge! Good length wide outside off, tries to play the late cut but the ball goes over his blade. That was the knuckle ball
fuller ball outside off, slashes at it. Goes behind square to deep point
full on middle stump, pokes at it as he looks to turn the ball towards the gap on the leg side. But midwicket does well to charge in and stop the single
full on middle, Hetmyer shimmies down the wicket before defending

shouts of 'catch it' and holes out at long off! Astle gets among the wickets now. Full ball on off stump but it's the wrong'un. Tried to hit it straight over the bowler's head but it's sliced towards the off side. Simple catch for Ferguson
tossed up outside off stump, driven expansively through cover point where a fumble allows a run
googly. Wayward. Starts on leg stump at back of a length, slides down leg
back of a length slider at middle stump, tapped into the leg side off the back foot
googly again, clips the thigh guard as he looks to glance. Dribbles through to short fine
full at leg stump, driven on the up to long-on
back of a length and across off stump, left alone
back of a length outside off, tapped into the off side with soft hands and they steal a single. Lewis puts in a dive at the strikers end
short ball in the corridor, climbs up at an awkward height. Drops the wrists to let it go
yorker at leg stump, catches him on the pads as he looks to flick
pierces the off side. It's overpitched from Boult and there's width. Mohammed puts in a big stride and slashes through the line to beat cover to his left
good length at leg stump, shapes for the flick but has to adjust quickly and tap this back down the pitch. It was set to climb towards the outside edge
back of a length at middle stump, squeezed into the leg side off the inside edge
oh beauty. All balance from Mohammed as he puts this full ball away. Hardly any feet as he goes after this outside off. High elbow and punched past mid-off
146kph, back of a length outside off, left alone

pace is pace. 142kph ball, slants in from a length outside off. Mohammed not as assured in his shot making against this one. Stabs at it in the corridor, offers a passage in and the ball kisses the inside edge first before tonking the stumps
and it's a decoy. Gets a yorker first up, in the corridor. He's not expecting that. Sneaks through from under his bat
back of a length at leg stump, nudged to fine leg off the thigh
back of a length at leg stump, flicked to square leg's right
short ball at middle stump, defended on the back foot
hook shot lands in front of fine leg as Lewis fails to get on top of this short one. Climbs up at his ribs and he gets under it too much
back of a length outside off, extends his arms to tap this on the up to cover point
full at off stump, shuffles to pick the leg side but hits it back straight to the bowler
back of a length on leg stump, stands tall and tickles it to fine leg to bring up his fifty. What a transitional year this man is having
short ball at leg stump, defended into the leg side

good length outside off, pushed into the off side and then a mix-up. Holder calls for the run as Williamson runs in from mid-off, then says no, then goes through. They're both stopped halfway down the track as he Williamson gets down on it. He doesn't pick up cleanly
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
back of a length on middle stump, pushed back to the bowler from the crease
back of a length at off stump, guided to third man off the outside half
oh what a shot. Looks to bowl an offcutter and lands it short and just outside off. Lewis contorts to make room before slapping it aerially, deliberately, to the extra cover fence
full at off stump, pushed to mid-off on the front foot
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
short ball at off stump, walks into it and swats it into the turf to get this between fine leg and deep square
back of a length outside off, bunted to extra cover on the up
bouncer dug in very short, ducks under it comfortably
full one at middle stump, clears the front leg and drills this back down the pitch. Ferguson sticks out a hand and parries it to long-off
length at off stump, offers the full face of the bat and feels it ping hard into the middle. Another mix-up, but neither batsman takes off this time as cover swoops down on it
elegantly pushed. Gets on his toes to smother the bounce and tap this wide of mid-off on the up
back of a length at the hips, whipped towards fine leg
148kph full delivery, at middle stump. Lewis clears the front leg again to try and hammer this straight. But he's late on it. Trickles through to mid-on off the toe-end

Ross you beauty! He has a retirement option in mexican waves. Leaps gracefully to his right, with perfect timing, to pluck this outside edge at third slip. It's a legcutter, good length outside off. Holder gets the front leg out out of the way to try and go over mid-off, but gets a thick edge that goes up but is one of those that quickly loops down if you leap too late
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
full at leg stump, early on the flick and he ends up chipping it over the midwicket region
back of a length outside off, dabbed to third man
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
oh shot. So good to watch, Evin Lewis. Stands tall in the crease and thumps this length ball on the up, straight over the bowler and into the boundary on the bounce
short ball, dug in too short. Batsman ducks easily, Latham leaps up, but can't get to it
good length outside off, left alone

<strike>tapped gracefully into the pitch to pitch to clear keeper and slip</strike> late on this length ball as it climbs rapidly in the corridor. It smacks into the turf off the face of the bat and bounces over the keeper
back of a length at leg stump, deflected off the pad towards fine leg
back of a length on middle, defended off the back foot
swipes and misses this 144kph short ball. It's speared across off stump and he looks to pick the square leg fence. Was too wide for it
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, defended into the covers
bouncer at middle stump, hoops back in sharply off the surface and makes him sway away hurriedly
overpitched at middle stump, driven to long-on
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
gets glove on the attempted hook, gets too far under the bouncer. Lobs it up to fine leg's right
punished. You don't bowl there to this guy. Short ball on the hips. Swivels a touch and slices this over the long leg fence
good length at off stump, leans in and pushes through the covers
back of a length at off stump, pushed back down the pitch
tossed up at off stump, driven on the full, off the toe, to long-off
googly, slides in quickly at leg stump as he looks to tap this off the back foot. Hits to midiwicket
googly draws him forward this time, and beats the inside edge to hit him high on the thigh
back of a length outside off, pushed late off the back foot, straight to extra cover
slower ball, dropped short at the hips. Scoops it towards the fine leg fence where Ferguson lunges to his left with two hands and stops it low
slower bouncer, dug in too short. Climbs above head height and he lets it go
slower short ball outside off. Tennis-forehand type slap across straight over the bowler. Miscued and it lands short of long-on
good length at off stump, defended into the covers
length ball fired down leg side where Latham can't gather cleanly, parried to fine leg
short ball at middle stump, swivels and pulls it to fine leg's left
short ball down leg side, swatted with control down to fine leg
whew. Pure power, Slower ball dropped short and just outside off. He sits on the back foot and hammers this wide of mid-off, making his own room
back of a length at off stump, punched to long-on off the back foot

given lbw as he misses this googly. It's a full one at middle stump. He looks to sweep and looks to be trapped in front. But this is close because that has turned a long way. Was it missing off? Possibly. Lewis looks on in hope, but he's been told they're out of reviews. That's the end of his innings. Replays show it was missing off
length at leg stump. Pushes to midwicket's right and they look to steal a single. It's a bad decision. Would have been run out, but Latham has broken the stumps before the throw comes in
googly, short and in at leg stump. Waits for it nicely and tucks it to deep square's right
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
length at leg stump, poked into the leg side off the inside edge
short ball just outside off, pushed to point off the back foot
back of a length at leg stump, pushed into the leg side off the back foot
bouncer at off stump, can't get on top of it as he looks to play the hook
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
bouncer down leg side, swivels to hook, misses it. Southee appeals and turns around to see the umpire stretch his arms out
back of a length outside off, drives on the rise and aerially, to sweeper cover
slower ball, good length outside off. Wafts at it away from the body, beaten
googly just outside off, gets locked on the front foot and just manages to get bat to avoid being struck on the pad
won't survive this time though. Beaten on the inside edge by the googly as he stretches forward to defend. Caught on the back leg, right in front of middle stump. Looks plumb
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
googly, tossed up at leg stump. Struck on the pad as he looks to flick, going down
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
googly, back of a length at middle stump. Defended off the back foot
full and in at middle stump, flicked to deep square
slower ball, back of a length at middle stump. Defended to midwicket
short ball, angled across off stump. Looks for the late cut, beaten
awayswinging yorker, just outside off. Beaten as he looks to squeeze it through the covers
slower ball, full and wide outside off. Left alone
full outside off, tapped to extra cover from the crease
leading edge as he looks to flick this from off stump. Expecting the googly but this one's turned conventionally. Chip over cover in the end
tossed up at leg stump, yorked as he looks to flick. Trickles through the square leg area
googly outside off, driven to long-off
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
googly, short of a length outside off. Chopped to backward point
slider, good length at middle stump. Defended off the inside half. Gets it through square leg
short ball first up, gets big on Beaton, who does well to offer the full face of the bat. Defended from near his face
low full toss on off stump, bunted down the ground to mid on. The tail-ender can't get it away
short on off stump and angling into the right hander. Forces Beaton to duck. It doesn't look beautiful, but does enough to get under the ball
back of a length outside off, angles into Beaton, punched off the back foot firmly
slower ball, cutter on middle stump that angles past the batsman's edge. One-bounce through to Latham

overpitched full outside off as the angle takes the ball past Beaton's swinging bat. Can't make contact and there's daylight between bat and ball as it goes through to Latham. Appeal for caught-behind from Boult, the umpire ain't interested
full on middle, straightens after pitching, defended
tossed up on middle stump and another googly, turns into the batsman as it ricochets off his pads towards square leg
topspinner that jumps off the surface after pitching on middle stump, hits the batsman on his body before he can free his arms for the pull
back of a length outside off, spins into the right hander, defended off the back foot with soft hands
full ball tossed up outside off, defended with the bat's open face as the ball trickles down to short third man. But the fielder is there
full ball outside off, worked off the front foot to long on. Todd Astle finishes with a three-for on debut.
pulled in front of square but only a single. Back of a length outside off and allows the batsman to swivel with ease and lean into that shot. Straight to deep midwicket
extra short on leg stump and flies over the batsman's head. He didn't even have to duck, it was that short
full ball on middle stump, sees the ball through to his bat as he defends off the front foot
slower ball outside off stump, waits for the ball to come onto him before cutting to the fielder at point. Beaton's made only three runs in 21 balls.
another slower ball, this time it's the yorker outside off, dug away towards cover
another slower ball pushed across full and wide outside off, goes over the tram lines. He's got to re bowl
back of a length, nagging length just outside off, tries to punch it past cover but the ball whizzes past his blade and through to the keeper
back of a length just outside off, angles across the batsman's body as he tries to poke at it
back of a length outside off and angling into Powell, defended off the back foot with soft hands

slogged! Over deep midwicket and out of the ground! Falls near the ice-cream truck, that's how far it went. Good length outside off and angling into his body. Quick to gauge the length and smacks cross-batted after shuffling across to the leg side. Soars out of the stadium. New balls, please!
pitched extra short outside off and goes over the batsman's ears and through to the keeper. Powell half-ducks his way to safety
fuller ball on middle and angling down the leg side, worked off his hips to fine leg and there's the team 200
good length on middle but angling down the leg side this time. The batsman misses the whip off his pads but no harm done. An extra added to the total. WI will take that at this stage
short outside off and stays low this time. Straightens after pitching and takes the outside edge of the bat as he looks to push at the ball. Latham safe as ever
good length outside off, well blocked off the back foot to see the over out. Powell will take strike next over
good length outside off, slightly slower (124kph) to start off. Pushes at away from his body with the straight bat. Hit to cover
back-of-the-hand slower ball outside off stump. It's pitched full and Powell can only bunt this to long on for a single. Gets Williams back on strike. Southee won't mind
short ball outside off that forces Williams to get on all fours as he tries to duck away. Off balanced as he ducks under this vicious delivery
short on middle and going down the leg side this time, but the umpire thinks it's not a wide. That's the second bouncer of the over, reminds the umpire. A much better duck from Williams this time
switches back to the good length outside off, Williams gets inside the line of the ball and defends with the bat's open face
beautiful yorker on leg stump but efficiently squeezed away towards fine leg for a single. Did well to get bat to ball
overpitched full and wide outside off, tries to wedge his bat down and run it through to third man but can't make contact. Beaten for pace
full just outside off, crunching drive down the ground to KW at mid off. They scamper through for the run
good length on middle, slower ball this time. Drags his pull to deep backward square

they want the single, but better sense prevails as Powell runs back to his crease. Shorter ball outside off and poked towards point off the back foot. The fielder was all over that ball in a flash, and ensured there's no single
short on middle and angling into the batsman's rib cage, tiptoes and cuts past point to third man for a run
cutter pitched short-ish outside off, tapped with soft hands towards point and this time the call for the run is early
ultra slow outside off stump, the batsman tries to slog over the leg side but is through his shot too early. Takes the inside edge and trickles down to fine leg. How did that miss off stump?!
guided off the back foot to third man for a single. Short outside off and the batsman backs away to find that additional room
offcutter this time from Southee, rolls his fingers over the ball to bring the pace down. Muscled with a lot of gusto but off the toe end of the bat towards midwicket
yorker on off stump, squeezed away to mid on for a quick run
wild swing that fetches no runs. Short on off stump but dragged the pace down completely. Tries to pull but the ball was nowhere near his bat when he was done with his swing

short outside off and the pull is top edged over the keeper's head for a few more. Southee finishes wicketless, but he's bowled extremely well. Took a little bit of a tap from Lewis in one over, but excellent otherwise.
good length on middle stump and cramping Williams for room. Tucked off his waist to the fielder positioned at midwicket
backs away and converts this leg-side ball as a low full toss. Smacked past the bowler and past KW at mid off four a useful boundary. His highest ODI score!
wide outside off, sticks his bat out and guides to third man

short on middle and Powell attempts a wild leg-side swipe. He's all over the place. Tried to back away towards the leg side but the bowler followed him through. The extra pace gets the better of Powell
back of a length outside off and goes just over off stump! Stays slightly lower this time as the ball flies under Powell's swinging back and through to Latham
good length on middle and flicked off his gloves towards square leg. Calls early for the quick run, they complete it with ease

Deep midwicket almost takes a one-hander, but it's a maximum! Short outside off and this time Powell's pull connects. Off the middle of the bat, and while Henry sticks his hand out in the deep, the ball just does not stay in his palm

just over the ropes for six more! Low full toss because of the attempted yorker that goes all wrong. Front foot moved towards the leg side, bends his knee to get under the ball and muscles this over Boult
overpitched full outside off, sliced over point's head and this is trickling away for four more! Powell's maiden fifty!
low full toss wide outside off, drags his slog towards the fielder at cow corner this time

back of a length on middle and angling past the batsman. Tries to play a late dab but plays it too fine instead, just past the outstretched gloves of the keeper. It came off the batsman's gloves as well
yorker on leg stump to end the over, dug away to mid off and they race off for a single
short and wide outside off, way too short and the umpire does not think it's a wide. Williams had backed away to play the upper cut over the keeper but can't get bat to ball. Tough decision
full ball outside off, charges down the wicket and tries to slog back past the bowler, but the ball flies past his outside edge to Latham
another short ball and this time it's guided to Boult at third man
full and wide outside off, Powell gets under the ball in a flash and smashes this over long off's head. Great sound off the bat

carved inside out over cover and it looks like it's going for a six.. but no! Kane Williamson covers a lot of ground to run towards deep extra cover (from long off) and takes a sharp jumping catch on the run. Powell's useful innings has to end. Looked like a boundary off the bat but KW did extremely well.
overpitched full on off stump, dug away past point for some more runs and West Indies finish on 248 for 9!
full and angled across the corridor. Looks to nudge this through the covers, but the feet don't move. Beaten
overpitched just outside off, opens the face and slices this past backward point
back of a length in the corridor, swings back in after it passes the batsman who leaves it alone
full at middle stump, driven to mid-on
full at middle stump, firm punch to mid-on's right. Holder lunges to stop
good length, just outside off, left alone
136kph, short and wide outside off, looks to chop it but it rolls into the off side off the toe-end
full outside off, doesn't put in a stride as he looks to drive. Bat turns in his hands and ball rolls out to mid-off
good length outside off, straighter bat this time as he drives off the toe-end to mid-off
good length at middle stump, looks to drive on the up, squeezes into the leg side off the inside edge

slaps this high into the leg side. It looks like he's got a big pull shot away, but this is hit with the toe-end and it plonks into the turf and stops before the boundary. It was a climbing length ball outside off
full outside off, reaches out and doesn't time the cover drive
full on the pads, squeezed to fine leg's right with a close face
length across the corridor, left alone
full outside off, leans in nicely as he drives into the covers. Can't beat the man at extra
shot. Length at leg stump, big backlift helps him whip this powerfully through midwicket. Slightly aerial, but that's not usually a risk in the Powerplay
beaten. Looks to carve it on the up through the covers, but he's no close enough to it
overpitched outside off, caressed to mid-off's right
back of a length at off stump, squeezed to third man off the outside edge
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
143kph, back of a length at middle stump, punches back at the bowler firmly
144kph, back of a length in the corridor, sliced to third man off the outside half
back of a length at middle stump, defended on the back foot
short and in the corridor, drops his wrists to let it go
overpitched on leg stump, no effort to keep this flick down. Gets the front leg to the pitch and beats deep square to his right

slices above cover and Lewis can't get a hand after running backwards and diving. Length ball in the corridor. Looks to flay this over cover but he can't get his hands through it. There isn't enough room. Survives though
shot. Fully in control this time. Length ball in the corridor, punched firmly with a high elbow to beat mid-off
dropped off his own bowling. Full and in at off stump. Goes with hard hands and drives this back towards the bowler at head height. He can only get one hand on it and mid-on has to clean up
aerial again, but it's a checked-drive to beat mid-off. Wasn't to the pitch of this one outside off
144.6kph, short ball on the hips. Looks to swat it over short fine, cops it on the thigh guard
another boundary. NZ are racing away. Back of a length and climbing up in the corridor, but he's nicely in control as he arches back and nudges it past first slip
138.7kph, short and angled across the corridor. Arches back and lets this go
back of a length in the corridor, left alone
bouncer in the corridor, left alone
short one at the mid-riff, controlled pull out to deep square
another short one in the corridor. This one is too short. Left alone. He though of the upper cut
112.7kph, slower ball, back of a length at middle stump. Waits for it to arrive and chops straight to point
good length at middle stump, defended from the crease
short ball in the corridor. A strange attempted cut. He's hitting under the ball. Beaten
back of a length at off stump, clipped to deep square
gorgeous. Gets right behind the line of this length ball. It's not too full. He's offered the full face and punched it past the non-striker
back of a length at off stump, tapped to extra cover off the back foot
slower ball, full at middle stump. Watchfully pushed back to the bowler
brilliant work from Hetmyer at cover point to save four. It's a length ball across off stump and he times the square drive to perfection, but the debutant leaps low to his right to stop that
back of a length at off stump, defended into the off side
an ugly hoick from Worker. Short ball, wide outside off. Stuck halfway between a cut and a pull and ends up with the bat and head pointed in opposite directions
back of a length at off stump, dropped with soft hands to backward point's right
slower ball, back of a length outside off. Punched on the up to point

half-chance. Pummels this full delivery back at the bowler who has barely recovered in his follow through as this flies to his left. He gets a fingertip on it - and he's holding that finger now as he walks off the field - and it beats mid-on too
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
back of a length in the corridor, can't get bat on it as he looks to open the face and run it to third man
back of a length outside off, reaches out and slaps through the line to beat cover point
easy. Too easy. Short ball outside off, stands tall and allows it to arrive. Then, caresses it off the back foot through cover point
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length at off stump, toe-ends the attempted drive to mid-off
back of a length at off stump, tapped to point
uff. Slaughtered. Back of a length outside off and he has spanked this with a flat-bat. To the fence in under a second
back of a length at off stump, dropped into the off side with soft hands
crafty. Beaton's line is a bit predictable now. Short and angled away from the corridor. Worker has been happy to leave so far, but he makes the room this time and lifts it over slip
good length in the corridor, anxious waft outside off. Inside edge onto pad
back of a length outside off, chopped to third man
bouncer at middle stump, swivels and misses on the hook
slower ball, overpitched outside off. Puts him off a bit as he drives - it's aerial. But hit very hard and evades extra cover's dive to the right
short ball in the corridor, ducks under it
back of a length, wide outside off. Cut to sweeper's right
inside edge as he steps out at this length ball on middle. Looks to lift it inside-out over mid-off. It dribbles out to deep square
back of a length outside off, shuffles across, runs it to third man
short outside off, cut straight to point
short and across off stump, beaten as he looks to cut
back of a length in the corridor, gets beside the line and taps to third man
slower ball, full at off stump. Driven along the floor to long-off
dropped at point. Short ball at off stump. Cuts aerially with little room. Nurse, I think, sticks out his right hand at low to his right and puts it down. Difficult chance
back of a length at middle stump, dropped into the leg side with soft hands
back of a length in the corridor, defended into the off side
bouncer at off stump, shapes to play the hook but this gets up on him quick. He drops the hands
short and wide outside off, big outside edge as he makes a feeble attempt at a cut. No slip, third man too wide, four
back of a length at middle stump, defended on the back foot
back of a length, in at the pads. Can't get bat as he looks to play the glance
short ball outside off, chopped to third man
back of a length in the corridor, looks to dab it down to third man but it's too close. He's beaten
back of a length at off stump, dabbed to third man
back of a length outside off, looks to punch on the up through the off side. Hits it back to the bowler off the toe-end
short outside off, cut hard, but point dives to his left and parries this to sweeper cover
slower ball, full outside off. Can't get the hands through this attempted drive, beaten in pace
short ball at middle stump, pulls to deep square
short ball, zips in at this chest from the corridor. He looks to make room for the late cut, can't get bat on it
length outside off, nudges it into the gully area with soft hands to try and steal a single, but backward point is across quickly
short ball at middle stump, swivels, keeps the hook down and picks up the single at fine leg to bring up his fifty
back of a length at leg stump, can't get bat as he looks to whip this. Cops it on the thigh guard

shot. Hammered this short ball to deep square's right. West Indies are feeding him nicely for the horizontal bat shots. He won't let that go. Gets in position quickly and like he has all day, keeps it along the ground
short ball at the ribs, pulled out to deep square
full at the pads and clipped towards midwicket, who dives to his right but can't stop it cleanly
hello, welcome to the show. No sighter for Munro. Gets the front leg out of the way as this one drifts in full at off stump, and gets the the axe under this to clear mid-off
back of a length outside off, cut to sweeper cover
back of a length at middle stump, defended down the pitch
back of a length at leg stump, nudged through midwicket from the crease
short ball outside off, chopped to sweeper cover's right
slow ball first up, it's overpitched outside off stump. Dug away towards short cover
fullish on leg stump and clipped off his feet behind square for an easy four. Too slow and Munro can wait for it before using his wrists to flick this over the square-leg umpire
driven back past Worker to mid off. Full-ish ball on middle stump and angling away from Munro, but the batsman offered the bat's full face

soft dismissal! Good length on middle, and extra bounce does the trick this time. The ball sits up after pitching and takes the top of Munro's bat as he tries to punch off the back foot. Straight down short cover's throat
good length on off stump and turned off his hips towards midwicket. Gets bat to ball first up
good length on off stump, tapped towards mid on off the front foot for a quick run
back of a length outside off and enough room for KW to cut this late and fine. Deep point gives it a chase, but can't make it
wide outside off again, stays slightly low, once again takes the edge and flies past first slip. Four more runs
back of a length outside off, angling away from KW's money, cut to deep point
firmly defended off the front foot. Good length on middle and played with soft hands

what's happening here? The off stump is broken but no one seems to be celebrating. Ok, now Nurse is rejoicing. Good length on off stump and stays slightly low as the ball skids through after pitching. Zips under Worker's attempted cut shot and crashes into off stump. A well-constructed innings comes to an end
back of a length outside off, punched off the front foot back to Nurse. Straight ball
back of a length on off stump and angling into the right-hander, turned off his hips to deep midwicket for two more. Called early for the double
slow ball, eventually a loopy full toss on middle stump that KW could dispatch anywhere. Chooses to tap this to midwicket instead
good length outside off, defended off the front foot. Big 'no' so that the non-striker can hear
extra short outside off but Williamson's up for it.  Pulled along the ground exquisitely but will fetch him only a single
slower ball wide outside off, tapped to point. KW wants the run, and he's halfway down the wicket, but Taylor asks him to return. Good work by Gabriel to cut the single off
short outside off and angling into Taylor's body. Firmly pulled in front of square off the back foot. But straight to the fielder in front of midwicket
back of a length wide outside off, stays low as KW misses the cut. Sharp take from the keeper
back of a length outside off once again, cut late but point dives to his left and parries it towards short third man. Saves runs
back of a length outside off once more, punched off the back foot past cover, who dives over the ball. Intercepted by long off
same length outside off, brings out the cut shot, but can't thread the gap between short third man and point
straighter ball on middle stump, the arm-ball this. Tapped to short midwicket
flatter ball on the fourth-stump line outside off, punched to wide long off to get off the mark
fuller ball just outside off, driven off the front foot to cover. No run
slow back-of-the-hand ball on off stump, defended with soft hands as the ball dribbles away back to Williams
good length outside off, cut away from his body but straight to the man at point
full ball just outside off, through his drive too early. Takes the inside edge and flies past off stump to fine leg
extremely slow wide outside off, width to free his arms and cut furiously too, but the ball goes to one of the four infielders on the off side
good length on middle stump, walks across to get inside the line of the ball before flicking this off his hips to midwicket
tossed up full on off stump, driven off the front foot converting the ball into a low full toss. Diving effort from Nurse keeps the single off
full just wide outside off, defended with the bat's opens face but point intercepts before the batsmen could contemplate a single
good length on middle, KW goes deep into his crease to get that extra second before playing his shot. Flicked off his hips to deep midwicket
good length on middle but sliding down leg side. Taylor wanted to paddle sweep, but misses
back of a length flatter ball on off stump, waits for it before punching off the back foot past KW for a single to long on
width offered outside off, cut away square to the fielder in the deep. Comfortable stuff for these two
fuller ball just outside off, prods forward and works this off the front foot to the leg side. But short midwicket is poaching that region. Straight to Holder
loose ball to start off, and he's punished! Wide outside off and KW climbs onto that with ease, cut from top of the ball. The diving fielder at point does not stand a chace
good length on middle and angling down the leg side. Williamson misses the flick off his hips, however
slightly back of a length outside off, spongy bounce this time, forcing KW to defend off the back foot
good length outside off but angling into the right-hander's body. Turned off his hips to deep midwicket for a single
glorious straight drive! Full outside off and Taylor simply drives along the line of the ball. Off the middle of the bat and Gabriel can't get his right leg in the way. Races away off the surface

stays slightly low this time. Taylor changes his mind at the last moment,  after seeing that he'll be too cramped for space. It was pitched outside off but the sharp deviation in forced him to change the shot. Eventually worked towards midwicket unconvincingly
back of a length outside off, cut off the middle of the bat, but can't find the direction to thread the gap
back of a length outside off, cut to point
wide outside off, and enough width to find the gap past point to the deep
keeps it wide outside off, KW is comfortable to cut. But the fielder there stops

good length on middle this time and turned off his pads to deep midwicket for the second. Taylor turned slow and was in trouble, but the throw was a lob to the bowler. A harder through and Taylor was definitely in trouble
sticks with the short line outside off, punched square off the back foot for another single
full just outside off, walks down and punches back past Nurse to long off for more runs
quick hands on display from Taylor. A quick ball outside off but Taylor's bat speed is so high that the cut is timed to perfection as it bounces over point's outstretched hands. Superb shot
leading edge! But short of both cover and wide mid off. Good length on off stump and Taylor tries to play straight but he plays inside the line's ball. Takes a leading edge but falls safely
short on off stump and rising onto Taylor. Dropped with soft hands towards the leg side for a quick run. Negates the bouncer well and gets off strike
back of a length outside off, shuffles across to the off side and taps it towards point. Loud 'no'
short outside off and KW uses his wrists to whip this towards midwicket with soft hands. Lewis tries to race in and effect a run out, but drops the ball on his followthrough
back of a length and anging into Taylor's body. Firmly defended off the front foot to see Gabriel's over out
good length just outside off, waits for it on the back foot before tapping it to mid on
good length just outside off, walks down and offers the straight bat to punch it to mid off
too close to his body for the cut. Plays and misses. Good length just outside off but turns sharply into his body. Not in a position to cut the ball away. Sharp take from the keeper
finds the connection this time! Short outside off and cut from near his body to short third man, who misfields, allowing them to run across
back of a length outside off stump, blocked off the back foot
full on off stump, gets inside the line of the ball and eases into an on drive to long on
short outside off an angling in again, defended off the back foot towards mid on. No run
short outside off but enough width to carve this behind point. Some work for third man to do, as he intercepts the ball before it reaches the ropes
sticks with the back-of-a-length spot outside off, this time it's whipped off his hips to the gap between mid off and midwicket
short outside off and tries to pull this incoming delivery towards the leg side but misses his shot competely. Smacks his shoulder as the ball trickles away past the keeper for leg byes
slower ball just a little outside off, driven on the up but comes off the bat's toe end
short outside off, opens the bat's face and glances it to point off the back foot
tossed up full outside off, driven off the front foot to long off for an easy walk-through single. NZ milking the bowling now
flatter ball on a good length outside off, punched off the back foot to that same fielder at long off
straight ball on middle stump on a good length, turned off his hips to deep midwicket with ease. Good use of the wrists to play it behind square
slow, loopy ball pitching outside off stump, attempted cut that comes off the toe end of the bat
good length outside off, punched past the non-striker to long on. Only a single, however
tossed up full outside off, KW gets his big stride forward and defends with his eyes on top of the ball
Taylor's on the floor! Good length outside off and angles into Taylor. Stays low and goes between his bat and pad and hits his groin area. Ouch!
back of a length outside off as the natural angle brings the ball into Taylor. Defended with the bat's open face as the ball goes away towards cover point
bends his back this time, forcing the extra bounce off the surface. Short outside off and defended with soft hands. But comes off the top of his bat
full and wide outside off, crunching drive off the front foot, but the dive from cover stops the runs
short outside off again but much lesser bounce this time. Taylor was already tiptoeing before he chooses to play this off his hips to midwicket. No run, and surprises both batsmen
fuller ball outside off and driven towards the off side but straight to cover. Frustrating end to the over for Taylor. Just couldn't find the gaps
tossed up full outside off, shimmies down the wicket effectively yorking himself. Dug back to Nurse
good length outside off and KW watches this ball all the way through before tapping this past the non-striker, but Nurse dives to his right and stops the ball from going past
back of a length on middle, turning towards the leg side as the batsman nudges this across the corner past midwicket
tossed up full outside off, on drive to long on for a walk-through single
back of a length on middle, backs away and pulls along the ground towards cow corner and midwicket. No stopping that! Fifty partnership for the duo, their 22nd together
short outside off and angling into Taylor. Opens the bat's face as he glances it to point
full outside off and Taylor slashes at it away from his body. Flies away to the fielder at third man
back of a length ball that skids off the surface, KW stays put on his crease and defends with soft hands as the ball falls near his feet
good length outside off, stays low as KW defends off the back foot. No pressure
short outside off and pulled from near his shoulders. The bat turns in his hands this time, and can't time it well enough

short on off stump and KW gets inside the line of the ball to pull. Quicker ball this one and he misses his swipe completely as the ball goes down the leg side. The batsman wonders why it's not a wide
back of a length outside off, driven off the back foot towards cover for a quick single. Misfield again
short on middle and drags his pull behind square this time. Fine leg gives it a chase for a while before giving up. A boundary after a long wait
good length outside off and angling into KW. Defended with soft hands
played on! Inside edge and onto off stump. Short outside off and he tries to punch at it. Big gap between bat and pad, and that's a gone-r. Big break through
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
bouncer at the helmet, swivels and hooks to fine leg
good length at leg stump, puts in half a stride and flicks to deep square's right
short and angled into the corridor. Chops it to third man
attempted yorker on leg stump, clipped to deep square leg on the full
back of a length outside off, slices it to point on the bounce
short in the corridor, finds point with the cut
short in the corridor, steered to third man
good length at middle stump, watchfully pushed back down the pitch
good length in the channel, defended into the covers
good length at off stump, punched on the up to mid-off
short at the chest, hooked to fine leg
back of a length outside off, nudged to third man with an open face
short and at the chest, climbs on top of it and glances to fine leg
back of a length at middle stump, defended back down the pitch
back of a length at leg stump, whipped to deep square leg
short one outside off, hurries onto him as he pulls. He can only get it as far as mid-on
short and outside off, chopped to third man
short and into the ribs, swivels and steers another hook down to fine leg
slower ball, at a yorker length on off stump. Gets on top of it and jams it into the pitch to get a single as it bounces over the bowler
full at off stump, driven inside-out to sweeper cover
drifted in full at leg stump, driven to long-on
back of a length at leg stump, pushed to short fine's left
beats the fielder at point. It's short and outside off. He cuts late, in the fashion we saw so often in the series against India. Sweeper cover puts in a valiant chase, but he can't keep it in
back of a length at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, punched to sweeper cover
back of a length at leg stump, tickled fine off the hips

crunches a pull shot, only to find midwicket. That's not too short outside off. He brings out his strong wrists to adjust for the bounce and nails this shot. The fielder is grinning - he felt that one properly
back of a length outside off, sliced to third man
back of a length outside off, tapped to point off the back foot
back of a length skidder at leg stump, climbs up to thump the thigh guard as he looks to flick
back of a length at off stump, pushed to mid-off with soft hands
good length, drifted in at leg stump, Flicked to midwicket on the front foot

traps him in front. Given out lbw, review not taken. Tries to go too square with this flick shot. Nurse has slid it in from around the wicket. It appeared close - like it might go down leg. But the umpire and batsman are convinced it's out and that's a second wicket to Nurse. And they're right, replays show that's hitting leg stump
full at off stump, driven back at the bowler
good length at off stump, jabbed into the covers
full toss outside off, driven to long-off
floated up at a good length outside off, dropped into the covers with soft hands and their ambition to steal a single earns them some overthrows as Holder shies at the keeper's end
back of a length at off stump, dropped into the off side off the back foot
back of a length at middle stump, defended on the back foot
back of a length at leg stump, defended on the back foot
back of a length at leg stump, whipped to fine leg's right
short ball at off stump, looks to pull and edges it onto pad. It lobs up tantalisingly for Hope, but he can't reach it
good length at off stump, defended to mid-off
back of a length outside off, tapped to extra cover off the back foot
full at middle stump, flicked to long-on
back of a length at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
full at leg stump, flicked to midwicket who can't gather cleanly to his left
good length outside off, punched to extra cover's right and he stops it with a slide
back of a length at middle stump, punched back to the bowler
full at middle stump, driven to mid-on off the toe-end
good length at middle stump, pushed to mid-on on the up
short and wide outside off, looks to climb into the cut. Bottom-ends it to extra cover
short and in at the corridor, looks to cut late, beaten on the outside edge
back of a length at middle stump, cops it on the thigh guard as he looks to flick. Nicholls comes trough for the run before point can get to it
back of a length outside off, looks to drive it square, but he's late on it and under-edges in point's direction
good length at leg stump, driven to long-on
short and wide outside off, backs away and cuts it past extra cover. Mid-off is in too, no one is stopping that
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
full at leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
back of a length at off stump, exposes all his stumps as he backs away and cuts this to sweeper's left
back of a length at leg stump, pushed through square off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, guided to third man
slower ball, short and wide outside off. It spins back a long way but just manages to stay wide of the rails to be given
back of a length at off stump, defended to point
short one at middle stump, looks to bludgeon this but he's onto it early and is on the front foot, reaching out. Gets a top edge that lands safely to deep square's right
good length at off stump, tapped on the rise to extra cover
good length at middle stump, pushed to mid-on on the rise
short and into the chest, pulled uppishly towards deep square
good length outside off, driven on the up to extra cover

caught behind! No room to play the cut but he takes it on. Holder bowls in the channel from around the wicket, and rolls his fingers on this one. Gets some grip and lift, and that's enough to take the edge as Nicholls goes after it
short ball in the corridor, defended to point off the back foot
back of a length outside off, toe-ends it as he looks to punch through the off side
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
short one at middle stump, leaps off the floor to defend into the leg side
good length at middle stump, pushed to long-on on the up
good length at off stump, driven on the up to mid-off. Bang off the toe-end of the bat
full and into the pads, clipped to deep square
full at leg stump, driven to long-on
swings through the line to hammer this past the non-striker. First boundary in ODIs, and it's stylish. Drags this length ball from outside off and keeps his shape as he punches it to beat mid-on
nicely timed. Clips this length ball off his pads and to deep square's left
short ball at middle stump, keeps the pull down, gets it to deep square's left
full at off stump, clears the front leg to open up the off side. But he finds extra cover
short ball outside off, backs away and chops past wide gully to third man's right
low full toss on the pads, follows it with his hands and flicks it to deep square's left
floors him as he follows him down leg side with a bouncer. Nicely directed and he has to bring out his best Matrix impression to sway away from this. Falls down in the process
full at middle stump, leans in and clips it wide of mid-on
a wide ball and fantasy cricket players all over the world are going 'noooo'. Not New Zealand. Length ball fired down leg side gives them the win
